Key Match Events: Freddy Peralta pitched six scoreless innings.
William Contreras hit a two-run home run in the fifth inning.
Jackson Chourio had a run-scoring single in the fifth inning.
Blake Perkins hit a two-run double in the fifth inning.
Devin Williams secured his sixth save in seven chances with a 1-2-3 ninth inning.
Post-Match Reflections: Freddy Peralta expressed excitement about his performance, noting his fastball was key.
Brewers manager Pat Murphy praised Peralta and Contreras for their performances.
William Contreras emphasized the importance of attacking the zone.
Giants manager Bob Melvin reflected on the quick turn of events in the fifth inning and the team's resilience in scoring three runs.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Brewers moved to within 1 1/2 games of the Philadelphia Phillies for the second seed in the NL playoffs and two games behind the Los Angeles Dodgers for the top spot.
San Francisco had won seven of the last 10 games at American Family Field and nine of the last 14 overall dating to 2019.
Others: Giants' C Patrick Bailey could be activated from the 10-day injured list on Thursday.
Brewers' LHP Hoby Milner is set to begin a rehab assignment on August 30 with High-A Wisconsin.
RHP Hayden Birdsong will start for the Giants and RHP Aaron Civale will start for the Brewers in the next game of the series.
